extendedInfo.description: Students can practice each of these math problem types in three different exercise categories, for a total of 15 different types of exercise to choose from. In addition, you'll find 30 word problems that focus on addition and subtraction.Use Let's Do the Math as a set of math flash cards, or treat it like a series of puzzles. However you approach it, you may find that it helps your youngster learn math basics more easily.Applications is without any advertisement! The training  can be done for 8 different calculations: addition, subtraction, mixture of addition and subtraction, multiplication and division and mix of addition and multiplication.Each of calculations can be trained during three types of exercises: calculations of outcome of expression, comparing expressions and finding elements of expressions. Altogether it gives you 18 types of exercises.Separate exercise type is word problem activities which are done for addition and subtraction. There are currently 50 different word problems.For each type of activity dedicated advices in form of graphics or formulas help to solve individual tasks.Specific numbers for exercises are prepared using quite complicated semi random algorithm, which avoids giving the same result twice in the same training.During each training full history is recorded so you can review it after training. For each individual task number of corrections and advices is recorded.You can use this application as set of math flash cards or treat it as set of puzzles.

reviews.title: Very nice trainer!
reviews.comment: Lots of settings, nice appearance, convenient controls, tricky tasks! Superb! I love it! But there is a little bug in application - when I close it, my desktop freezes and I can do nothing for about five seconds and some widgets reacting on that, setting themselves by default... A bit annoying. I\'m using Samsung Galaxy SII.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Usability is bad
reviews.comment: Can\'t go back to home screen, stuck on calculation screen with just two problems each time.  App running on cyanogenmod ICS.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: This is really good for my daughter
reviews.author: rosemarie jose

reviews.comment: I downloaded this app as re-enforcement for my 7 yr old daughter while she\'s out of school. She loves it! Good job on the app!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: So far so good. My 6 yo had a great time. Waiting until done with all exercises before final star. Thanks Dev for your effort (especially help).
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: This math realy helps u I didn\'t know wat was 2-3+4= was and wen I found this wow it helped me the answer was 5 I know thus cus this math game

reviews.comment: It says this app. Is designed for kids 6~9 years old, and it is a perfect tool for helping that age group.

reviews.comment: I would like to point out that the red and green color scheme makes this app useless for colorblind students.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great for teachers
reviews.comment: Takes some exploring but since you figure out how to set things up it offers lots of variety including word problems.
reviews.author: A Google User
